Author: juicy_trappedbox
Text: you don't usually absorb as many calories as you think. it works kinda like that:  spit is one way for the body to break Polysaccharides (multiple-sugars/multible-sugar-chains) and double sugar into simple sugar but that only happens when you chew things very long. you can test that with bread. if you chew it long enough, it will start to taste sweet (that's when you know, that the multipe-sugars were broken down) and i believe only then it is possible for the body to absorb the simple sugar though the palates. and it doesn't happen that quickly either.
